item.title: Linux Policy Routing - Introduction
item.description: Policy routing actually allows us a great deal of flexibility in how we direct traffic out of a Linux host. There are a couple parts involved in policy routing: Policy routing tables: Routes added to the system without a routing table specified go to the main table, not the default table. Linux comes with three default. Local (cannot be modified or default) Main Default Policy routing rules: Linux comes with three rules, one for each of the default routing tables When we’re trying to used policy routing for our purpose we need to do three things:

item.title: Linux Introduction
item.description: Linux is a computer operating system. An operating system consists of the software that manages your computer and lets you run application on it. The features that make up Linux and similar computer operating systems include the following. Detecting and preparing hardware When you turn on your computer, the Linux system will boot up and loads the software (drivers and modules) needed to access those particular hardware devices.
